node.title: Darrell Brooks Should Not Have Been Released on Low Bail, Milwaukee DA Admits
node.alt: Police cordon off a crime scene on November 21, 2021 in Waukesha, Wisconsin
node.description: The district attorney said the $1,000 cash bail set for Brooks on November 5 was "inappropriately low" given the charges he faced.
node.content:
["The Milwaukee County district attorney admitted Monday that Darrell Brooks, who has been named a person of interest in the Waukesha, Wisconsin, parade crash, should not have been released on $1,000 bail earlier this month.", "Reviewing the pending charges against Brooks, which include recklessly endangering safety and battery, the district attorney said that the $1,000 cash bail set for Brooks on November 5, which he posted on November 11, was \"inappropriately low.\"", "\"The State's bail recommendation in this case was inappropriately low in light of the nature of the recent charges and the pending charges against Mr. Brooks,\" District Attorney John Chisholm said in a Monday statement.", "\"The bail recommendation in this case is not consistent with the approach of the Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office toward matters involving violent crime, nor was it consistent with the risk assessment of the defendant prior to the setting of bail.\"", "", "
Police cordon off a crime scene on November 21, 2021 in Waukesha, Wisconsin
", "Chisholm said his office is conducting an internal review of the bail recommendation for Brooks.", "Brooks has been named a person of interest in the mass casualty incident that occurred at a Waukesha Christmas parade on Sunday evening, when a car plowed through a crowd and left at least five dead and dozens more injured.", "This is a developing story and will be updated as more information becomes available."]
